meanings.sent1: The new student was a lubber in sports.
meanings.sent2: The lubber tripped over his own feet.
meanings.sent3: The lubber tried to juggle but kept dropping the balls.
meanings.sent4: He felt like a lubber trying to dance for the first time.
meanings.sent5: The lubber's lack of coordination was evident to everyone.

meanings.definition: A person who is inexperienced or unskilled in sailing.
meanings.sent1: The young lubber struggled to tie the knots on the boat.
meanings.sent2: The lubber had never been on a sailboat before.
meanings.sent3: The lubber accidentally raised the wrong sail and went in circles.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a lubber lost at sea without a compass.
meanings.sent5: The lubber's first sailing lesson was a memorable experience.

meanings.sent1: The lubber lounged on the couch all day.
meanings.sent2: The lubber avoided doing any chores.
meanings.sent3: The lubber pretended to be asleep to avoid work.
meanings.sent4: She was a lubber when it came to helping out around the house.
meanings.sent5: The lubber's laziness knew no bounds.
